metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15010 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A ReDoS (regular expression denial of service) flaw was found in the tough-cookie module before 2.3.3 for Node.js. An attacker that is able to make an HTTP request using a specially crafted cookie may cause the application to consume an excessive amount of CPU.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-15010` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

node-tough-cookie - 2.3.4+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: node-tough-cookie package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.4+dfsg-1').
